intro: Heliotropium fruticosum var. angustilobum, commonly known as narrow-leaved heliotrope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple, often with a distinctive scent. Its leaves are usually narrow and elliptical, and it thrives in well-drained soils. This species is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
